definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.english: The bunker was able to workindependently for two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这座地堡能够独立运行两个星期。

sentences.english: Putting a Bunker here also gives you a head start on defending the gap later.
sentences.chinese: 在这边放一个地堡也能帮助你接下来在此的防守。

sentences.english: Be sure to post an SCV in Auto-Repair mode just behind each Bunker.
sentences.chinese: 保证每个地堡旁边都跟着一个开着自动修理的SCV。
以色列已经持有一些“地堡杀手”核炸弹。

sentences.english: The name of the bunker is tiled in there.
sentences.chinese: 地堡的名字被装饰在那儿。

sentences.english: The bunker really wasn't that big.
sentences.chinese: 地堡真的没有想象中的那么大。

sentences.english: A long tiled passage leads to the main part of thebunker.
sentences.chinese: 一条用瓷砖装饰的过道通向地堡的主要部分。
地堡埋地时间缩减成6秒。

sentences.english: Always keep an SCV behind each Bunker for swift repair.
sentences.chinese: 总是让一个SCV在地堡后面随时进行维修。

sentences.english: He was in a purpose-built bunker and had been there for some time.
sentences.chinese: 他呆在一座特定用途的地堡里，已经有一段时间。

sentences.english: Again back to the foxholes and bunkers.
sentences.chinese: 我们只能返回散兵坑和地堡。

sentences.english: When he reached the top, one of the target bunkers opened fire on him with machine guns.
sentences.chinese: 爬到崖顶后，一个目标地堡的机关枪向他开火。

sentences.english: Use a black hand to clear out garrisons , and then take it for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 用黑手清掉驻守的步兵，然后自己占一个地堡。

sentences.english: The two halls were the heart of the bunker.
sentences.chinese: 两个大厅是这座地堡的中心。

sentences.english: Use a Black Hand to clear out garrisons , and then take it for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 用黑手清掉驻守得步兵，然后自己占一个地堡。

definition: pillbox (military fortification)/blockhouse/euphemistic way of writing 屌爆[diao3 bao4]
defensive structure/military fortifications/(Tw) construction works/civil engineering works
